intro: Chenopodium sancti-ambrosii, commonly known as Ambrosia blite, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Chenopodium sancti-ambrosii is adapted to arid conditions and has a short growing season, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
